TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HtmlWindowCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable
type HtmlWindowCollection = class interface ICollection interface IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Represents the windows contained within another .

remarks.format:
## Remarks An HTML document may consist of a `FRAMESET` that defines multiple fixed `FRAME` objects, each of which contains its own HTML page. Alternatively, a document may contain a number of `IFRAME` objects, which can position documents arbitrarily inside of other documents. `FRAME` objects and `IFRAME` objects are represented at their top-most level by an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HtmlWindowCollection>, which contains elements of type <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HtmlWindow>.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.HtmlWindowCollection> supports the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> interface so that it can be used in loop constructs. It also defines an Item method, which allows access to the elements of the collection either via a method call or using standard array syntax.
If you create new windows with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HtmlWindow.Open%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HtmlWindow.OpenNew%2A> methods, and the documents hosted by these windows contain `FRAME` or `IFRAME` elements, that these elements will appear in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HtmlWindowCollection> of the parent page.
For more information on frames, see the documentation for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HtmlWindow.Frames%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example inspects each document within a page containing frames and creates a table of all of the outgoing hyperlinks from each page for future inspection.
[!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.HtmlWindow#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.HtmlWindow/CS/Form1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.HtmlWindow#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.HtmlWindow/VB/Form1.vb#2)]

Docs.summary: Retrieves an item either by its property or its position in the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HtmlWindowCollection.Item%2A> enables access to the elements of the collection using array syntax.

MemberSignature.Value: Default Public ReadOnly Property Item(index As Integer) As HtmlWindow
public: property System::Windows::Forms::HtmlWindow ^ default[int] { System::Windows::Forms::HtmlWindow ^ get(int index); };

Docs.param: The position of the within the collection.
Docs.summary: Retrieves a frame window by supplying the frame's position in the collection.
Docs.value: The corresponding to the requested frame.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HtmlWindowCollection> is a zero-based collection. If there are *N* elements in the collection, valid arguments to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HtmlWindowCollection.Item%2A> are the integers from 0 to *N*-1.
Windows are not laid out in <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HtmlWindowCollection> in any predetermined order.

Docs.exception: is greater than the number of items in the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: Default Public ReadOnly Property Item(windowId As String) As HtmlWindow
public: property System::Windows::Forms::HtmlWindow ^ default[System::String ^] { System::Windows::Forms::HtmlWindow ^ get(System::String ^ windowId); };

Docs.param: The name of the to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Retrieves a frame window by supplying the frame's name.
Docs.value: The element corresponding to the supplied name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HtmlWindowCollection.Item%2A> will return a single element whose <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElement.Name%2A> property corresponds to `elementId`. If the document contains multiple elements with the same name, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HtmlWindowCollection.Item%2A> will return only the first one in the collection. If you need to retrieve all elements with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElement.Name%2A> property of `windowId`, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.HtmlElementCollection.GetElementsByName%2A> method instead.

Docs.exception: is not the name of a object in the current document or in any of its children.
